website_summaries.verdict: Sennheiser's new RF-based wireless headphone system is easy to set up and delivers strong performance for both movie watching and music listening.
pros: The Sennheiser RS 175 RF Wireless Headphone System offers impressive wireless sound, a comfortable fit and extended range (through walls), and easily connects to your TV, computer or any audio source with the included cables
Connection is rock-solid and features include faux surround and bass boost modes
cons: Somewhat pricey compared with Bluetooth options
base station/charging stand feels a little cheap

customer_reviews.title: Bought this in July 3, 2016 and the ear ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in July 3, 2016 and the ear cups are falling apart. You pay over $200 & they give you such cheap ear cups. Add another $30 something dollars for new ear cups. Ridiculous, will never buy their product again. (RS 175 RF)
customer_reviews.author: couchpotato

customer_reviews.title: Ear pads were designed to fail, so it seems.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a longtime seinheiser client, this most recent pair of headphones is good but not great. The ear pads are worthless ocean plastic. Luckily I’ve jerry rigged the one broke ear pad with Command Strips (double sided sticky pads) to maintain functional integrity without spending more money on more ocean plastic : ) The clips three clips are flimsy, once one breaks, the remaining clips integrity is tested even more, eventually u will need more money, or more Command Strips. I’m thinking of a better long term solution in meantime. I bought these, like, 1.5 yrs ago.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Rondo ala Turk

customer_reviews.title: Pay Attention to those low grades!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged, attractive device. I should have listened to the reviews that talked about defective charging and not really able to attain digital mode. Returned it, very disappointed. I think when you see so many good reviews, one tends to ignore that One star 10% could mean 300 people found it to be very poor. The headphones were actually very bulky and uncomfortable. I falsely assumed the high price was well founded.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbertrubin

customer_reviews.title: These are the best there is and thats sad.
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with these. The sound quality is less than my Bluetooth earbuds. There are some frequencies that are severely underrepresented. But they last a long time and the recharger/dock/stand/receiver all in one is great. I don't know of anything better. But I hope someday there will be until then these are the best there are. Also the audio fluctuate every few minutes
customer_reviews.author: Jacob E. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were to be used in my theater room, so as not to disturb my wife at night. Problem is, they don't work I have tried every out put on my TV digital, analog, and TV speaker and every setting from PCM, bitstream and so on, and not a sound. The green light on the base unit is on so it is receiving the signal, and the headset is turned on, and no sound. I GIVE UP!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: 1951 MERC

customer_reviews.title: It is a piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: We recently upgraded our entire home enertainment system (Over $6,000 worth)... I wanted to get a equal quality headset so I could continue to enjoy our new system while my wife sleeps... This headset has wonderful sound and range.... However, after eighteen hours of sporatic service it stopped working all together... I had three different tech support people attempt to make it work... One actually called the company for advice as nothing he tried worked.... I should have paid closer attention to the one star reviews... It this case they were all spot on.... Don't waste your money on this piece of .. er... JUNK
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Cover

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but very limited range.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 sets of Senheiser TR110 & HDR 110 transmitters/headphones. I primarily listen to my stereo receiver or streaming from the computer and can walk 100ft+ from the transmitters before losing the signal. I usually use these while doing things around the house and even outside. 1 headset wore out so I thought I would upgrade to a better setup. The HDR175 costs 3X the 110's but only have about a 20' range before hiccups and past 30' these are useless. Yes, they sound great but what a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Zoller

customer_reviews.title: Expensive JUNK
customer_reviews.text: these headphones lasted about 5 months, sometimes working sometimes not until they died completely. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: 000 on hearing aids and have bought 3 different wireless headsets with no success in being able to enjoy TV. If you have the hearing problem that ...
customer_reviews.text: This is what I have been looking for. Several years I have spent trying to find a way to watch TV and understand what is being said. It has been especially difficult to understand when women or children are speaking. I have a hearing problem with higher frequencies. I have spent up to $10,000 on hearing aids and have bought 3 different wireless headsets with no success in being able to enjoy TV. If you have the hearing problem that I have This might be the answer I wish I had found this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. M

customer_reviews.title: Can't get them to work, setting them up - ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't get them to work, setting them up - instructions said I had to buy batteries, ordered batteries - went to install them to find batteries in headphones - will not charge - installed new batteries - will not charge - unfortunately return date was much shorter than other Amazon orders
customer_reviews.author: Softwindz

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Sennheiser headphones. My old pair are about 6 years old and still work, but I was starting to have issues with them cutting out. This new pair has a longer range and better sound quality. I've also had 2 pairs of Bose headphones QC-15 and I have to say these are every bit as good performance/function-wise. The dynamic range isn't as good as the Bose, but I use these for TV only. If you're looking for a good, reliable, headphone you will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: sking

customer_reviews.title: If you are hard of hearing, this will make your day.
customer_reviews.text: I am 64 and after many years of working in a loud plant, my hearing isn't as good as it use to be. I have used wireless headphones before with my TV, but I was getting static as I would rock in my recliner. I tried using a wired amp, with headphones, but I missed being able to move about as I listened to my TV. I can now walk from my bedroom to the kitchen, all the while listening to the news. These wireless headphones are everything I was hoping for, They fit great and are very comfortable. The sound is amazing and there is no static, when rocking or moving about the house. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Great...when it’s working
customer_reviews.text: Still have my old wireless headphones from Sennheiser (10 years old). Just wanted something more comfortable to wear. Hence this purchase. Pros: Comfortable to wear, adjustable so it fits a larger and smaller head size. Decent sound quality for music and movies. Easy setup. Cons: Audio interrupts and thus causes disruptions in dialogue while watching programs. This can be slight to lengthy. I’m unsure if this is a battery issue. Battery, this I replaced with high quality recharable batteries. It didn’t help with the issue. I will be contacting the manufacturer about the issues because I don’t think this customary for Sennheiser. I’ll update my comments later but this is my experience thus far
customer_reviews.author: dagny

customer_reviews.title: Very unstable, erratic signal
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these headphones. Both would cut out without any reason. It was truly annoying. We returned them and got two replacements, thinking the first pair were defective. The second pairs did exactly the same thing. My granddaughters tried to use them and abandoned them because they were so "glitchy". I returned these, too. Either there is a severe design problem or quality control problem. I found some other reviews that had the same experience. Most reviewers loved their headphones. We did too, until we encountered the stability problems. Its truly unexpected in such an expensive well-reviewed product. I do not recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: W. R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and reception - will want a 3.5mm to RCA for most receivers
customer_reviews.text: The base transmitter has ports for optical input and for a 3.5mm phone input. Optical inputs are no longer commonly used and are normally going to a receiver input port and so worthless. The 3.5mm phono jack requires a 1/4" adapter and to be plugged into the front of a receiver which is little better than wire headphones. I bought a 3.5mm phono to RCA male pair cable so I could use the outputs from my receiver to provide a signal to the headphones. The RCA cable should have been provided by Sennheiser.
customer_reviews.author: WinterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great for late night listening or living with sensitive types with control issues who demand quiet media volume.
customer_reviews.text: You are not losing your hearing, some folks are just too precious for 21st century life. You know who I am talking about. Great for late night listening or living with sensitive types with control issues who demand quiet media volume. Sound not entirely audiophile but good enough for TV viewing and listening while you work. Very large sounds like that drumbeat on the GOT theme seem to overwhelm the amp and results in annoying jarring dropouts. Wishing the volume was adjustable in an old fashioned analog style infinite range instead of large push button steps that are sometime too loud or too soft. Same for that bass boost on-off only which can quickly become painful as the soundtrack changes.
customer_reviews.author: Kev'n

customer_reviews.title: I bought him some Sony headphones but they weren't easy to use and the volume level wasn't there for ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband is hard of hearing. Even with hearing aids, he listens to our television at close to the highest level it will go (about level 48). when I am alone, I listen to the television at about a level 8 to 10. I bought him some Sony headphones but they weren't easy to use and the volume level wasn't there for him. With these headphones, I can stay in the room with him to watch television and he doesn't have to ask me "What did they say?". He can adjust the bass and treble according to what he is listening to and that helps him a lot. I am very happy with these headphones and so is he.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent headphones--but constant quality issues
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones-sound reproduction excellent while watching tv. However, the is a defective headphone with audio dropping out periodically. I am now on my THIRD set of headphones, with two previous returns, due to the defective audio dropout. Would expect higher quality and quality control from Sennheiser. Amazon has been great in working with me returning defective headphones and replacing with new. If you can find a set of working headphones, it is certainly worth the cost. One issue: the controls for increased volume, surround sound, base assist difficult to use with controls on the headphone and very close together.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read all the reviews you can before buying.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great except connectivity. Never had a device that disconnects as bad as this. Set up as far away from routers, cordless phones or anything else that's emits interference. In an age where everything is digital AND wireless, this thing can't compete for bandwidth and is easily disconnected. All things aside, it's sounds phenomenal. Sorry though, I just can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymously

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: So frustrated...my son and I bought this for my husband because he can't hear the TV but it didn't last 6 months! Now it's just sitting in the box it came in taking up space. We purchased one of these for him a long time ago - not this brand, a cheaper one and it never worked, so we thought spending more would make a difference. It did but only for about 3 months!! Thankfully now with bluetooth technology, you don't have to use one of these if you have a smart TV and bluetooth headphones. I guess this will just be another item I will throw out eventually.
customer_reviews.author: tgs1117

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Audio
customer_reviews.text: I had to return them for a refund. The sound was extrememly good and I enjoyed them for maybe 3 weeks then the audio began to drop out every so often. If it had been for only 1 or 2 seconds I might have kept them however sometimes I had no audio for anywhere from 6 seonds to almost 30 seconds. Changing the cables did not result in a solution. They were always fully charged so that was not the problem. No choice but to rate them 1 star. Very disappointing for $200.
customer_reviews.author: Captain

customer_reviews.title: Sound great but frequent audio drops.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great but for whatever reason the frequently drop all audio for about one full second. This does not happen when using any other pair of headphones I have or when using regular speakers. My receiver is about 3 feet away from where I sit so I don't think it's an issue with the signal. I'm not entirely sure what the issue is, whether some other wireless signal is interfering with them or the set I have is just faulty. I keep them fully charged whenever I wear them. Apparently I missed the 30 day return/exchange date which is extremely disappointing as they were pricey for something that doesn't do what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound glad I got em
customer_reviews.text: So far I like them. Probably much better. I had just turned them on an I had to make sure I put the volume on the tv to zero. No delay. The volume is much better. I have a hearing loss in right ear. Only thing that could bebetter is if I can figure out if I can make one side louder than the other. Someone said they don't adjust. The 175 does and should not fit too tight on most. They are snug but not uncomfortable. 5 stars so far. If something changes I'll adjust review. I left the battery stars at 5 but would not mind a "name brand" as long as I can safely do so.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cvetic

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty amazed. Now my only problem will be getting ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a joint gift to my husband from my two sons and me. My husband is hard of hearing, but very resistant to doing ... well, anything ... about it. He's previously rejected the idea of headphones because he doesn't want the discomfort, and also doesn't want to be "tied" to the TV with a cord. My younger son, who is a gamer, picked these out for us to give my husband for Christmas, and I have to say, he LOVES them. I'm pretty amazed. Now my only problem will be getting him to take them off ....
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to wear!
customer_reviews.text: Good sound overall and fairly easy to set up.The major drawback to these headphones is the weight and how they press down on your head! The section of the headphone that attaches to the cradle and charger does not have any padding.This and the overall weight of the headphones causes undue pressure on the top of one's head.I could not wear them for more than 2 minutes for that reason. I am baffled why no one else who bought these did not have that issue.For me it made the headphones unusable.
customer_reviews.author: gabe

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money...it's like being in your own personal theater.
customer_reviews.text: These were very easy to setup. Check your TV to see if you have more than one optical output. If not, like my TV, I ended up buying an inexpensive optical one to two connector/splitter. I'm impressed with the sound quality of the headphones. It's great to watch and action movie and not disturb anyone in the house. Again, it's like having your own personal home theater experience. No outside noise, as loud as you want, and comfortable. So, if you are in the market, don't hesitate... these are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Frank R Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY! Headphones that have enough VOLUME!
customer_reviews.text: I am about 75% deaf. I have been through about 6 pairs of headphones, trying them to see if I could hear with them and returning them because I couldn't. I ordered these and a set of buds and at long last, both have enough volume and I will be able to KEEP THEM. The search has been exhausting and exasperating, so I am seriously relieved!
customer_reviews.author: Rie H

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's annoying having to hold the power button to turn it on. After less then a year (8 months) of use the left speaker just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: simon

customer_reviews.title: Sound is really good considering its a headset, my first real pair.
customer_reviews.text: I am used to a gaming set that hurt my ears, these are much more comfortable. My only complaint is they fit a bit tight, i'd prefer they fit a bit looser i feel they squeeze my head a bit too much to be comfortable. I am shocked at how good the sound is. I do actually feel like i'm there. Price is a bit steep and i was hesitant at first but i figured i could send them back if i dont like them. I will be keeping these. I guess the only other con would be i can use them with my PC.
customer_reviews.author: I am quite picky

customer_reviews.title: I suffer from hearing loss; I can watch TV now without disturbing wife or neighbors.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go with a long-revered company, Sennheiser. I am not disappointed. These are fabulous and definitely what I needed. Living in an apartment, I just decided it was not worth buying a sound system with sub-woofer and such. These Sennheiser headphones are just the ticket. I stay up later than wife and can listed to whatever I want as loud as I want without disturbing my spouse's sleep or the neighbors. They were the perfect accessory for our Samsung QLED TV.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Sound Decent, but Surround Sound not Great
customer_reviews.text: These wireless headphones sound fairly good with normal content, but the surround sound effect is pretty limited (2 settings). These are not super cheap headphones, so I had hoped for a somewhat better TV/movie viewing experience. I have not had much in the way of interference, so Sennheiser seems to have solved that problem from an older series of wireless headphones I have owned. Charging could be a bit faster, but they are standard AAA (Ni-MH) rechargeable batteries (external charging and/or having a per-charged set on hand for quick exchange, are options).
customer_reviews.author: PlasticDiscPlayer

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Headset
customer_reviews.text: Undoubtably the best headset you can buy for the hearing impaired. Tried ZVOX as well as other brands claiming to be for the hard of hearing. Do not waste you money. The Sennheiser headsets are in my opinion the best you can buy. Clear crisp audio right at your ears as opposed to soundbars that claim to be for the hard of hearing. Purchase these and you will not be sorry you did. One suggestion. Do not increase the headset volumn to loud remembering that they are right on your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Kathie G

customer_reviews.title: Fiber cable is included
customer_reviews.text: There is no need to buy a separate fiber cable because one comes with the headphones. Amazon's suggestion box suggests you need one. As far as the RS175 goes, it's a fantastic unit. We have the unit in our house and bought an identical setup for a 2nd place we stay. Have the add'l headset also. Super easy to setup. Pairs automatically. Great fidelity. Bought extra AAA rechargeables (Panasonic) and a Panasonic wall charger. I find it easier to have ready -to-go rechargeables than to hang the headsets on the stand for recharging. Besides, the stand is hidden behind the TV. Summary: This is a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect it to work out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I may come back and change this if I can get this to work. When one pays this much money for a product, one expects it to cone with what is needed to work. Turns out Sennheiser didn’t believe in that. AND the only way I could find that out was by calling their technical department—they couldn’t even be bothered to put the info in their literature. Horrible customer service. “ Oh, you need a $4 part and you will have to order it”
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: These Sennheiser Wireless headphones will save your marriage!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I purchased the Sennheiser RS 175 RF Wireless Headphone System because now I can watch DVDs, sports and streaming shows or movies on my 55-inch plasma TV at DIRECTOR'S INTENT VOLUME without making a sound in our small house. It is saving my marriage. The adjustable surround sound feature is cool. We have a Samsung TV and home theater Blueray player so are able to use Samsung's AnyConnect feature to send the audio from the player back to the TV, then using the TV's settings direct the sound to 'External Speakers' which is where the Sennheiser base unit connects via its digital optical cable.
customer_reviews.author: O'Neill Family

customer_reviews.title: Limited input capabilities
customer_reviews.text: The headset is reasonably comfortable. Sound sometimes drops for a short time or skips. Experienced this on Analog input. Optical may work better. The unit ONLY supports PCM signal on Optical input. There is no DOLBY support which means that you have to configure your device's audio output to PCM instead of DOLBY. Unit has no Digital COAX input which on many devices is the only type of digital output available. My Bluray player was like that. I solved that by ordering this: Digital Coaxial to Optical Converter, Bi-Directional Coax Digital Audio Converter. It has an Optical and a COAX input and a switch to select whichever one you're going to use.
customer_reviews.author: Moon Man

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Good for the first 14 months with a fair range. Not Great but good. After 14 months of use, the pick-up on one channel started to occasionally be intermittent. Today I had a channel go out completely. For this much money, when I die, my children should be going through my stuff, find it, and even though it still works, they should throw it away because it is too old for them to look cool while using it. Two stars because it was TEMPORARILY an adequate wireless headphone set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Wireless Headset !!!
customer_reviews.text: I am rewriting my review as my first attempt at getting the headset to perform was awful so I wrote about the less than awesome performance of this headset. BUT, the reason it wasn't performing correctly was my fault and not the quality of the headset. Basically the sound was dropping out often enough to make it impossible to listen to anything. I went through all of the troubleshooting steps without any success so I started over by resetting ALL of the settings on my TV. Hooked the RS-175 headset back up and it is NOW working great. I am a VERY happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected or could have asked for.
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased two units so that I can enjoy movies late night without waking anyone up. Out of the box once I turned one on it didn't register any sound right away. However, upon further inspection I suspect that it was searching for a channel so don't be discouraged if it doesn't have any sound right away. It is well constructed and sturdy. Pros: -Nice sleek design. -Buttons easily accessible on the headset. -Comfortable Cons: -uses AAA batteries( and even I don't think this is a huge issue) -can only charge one headset at a time unless you buy another receiver. -Max of two headsets per receiver. Comment Comment | Permalink
customer_reviews.author: TechnoNerdTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes You Don't Know What You're Looking For Until You Find It
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are everything I didn't know I needed. The picture made me believe this set would be more of a gray and champagne color scheme but it's actually a nice black/silver scheme so it's far from being unsightly, in fact they look amazing on a desk. I was previously using my pair of Beats Solo 3 headphones but I needed something that'd feel more relaxing to wear at a desk for hours on end. And the fact that these come with their own stand/amp/recharging station thing is absolutely incredible. Sennheiser has really outdone themselves again. I love German engineering because of that sense of practicality they have locked down. I hope they made keyboards and mice one day, too!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Really great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a 25 year old pair of analogue Sennheiser cordless headphones, I have to say that these things are incredible! There is no static like my old ones and the range is outstanding, I was able to go half way in my back yard and still hear perfectly and the base was in my master bedroom!
customer_reviews.author: Laserboy

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a present for my husband who has hearing problems. About 10 years ago, I bought him his first set and these are a replacement for the older ones that had a broken wire. He loves them and is enjoying the new changes with the second set. They should last another 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Penny M

customer_reviews.title: Great with vdrums, no lag, amazing sound.
customer_reviews.text: This headphones really deliver quality and i use them with my roland vdrums and it sounds amazing. The down side is they dont come with a 3.5mm to 1/4 converter so i had to buy one separately. Using the drum module i was able to adjust the pads/cymbals in the correct direction (left, center, right) and the surround sound really makes a difference. Also the bass sounds amazing when using the kick-pad. I really like my new headphones because before i was using a wired pair and that is really annoying when you are moving around the kit. And there is no lag in the sound that was my main concern when purchasing this headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: It was not until we purchased this item and opened ...
customer_reviews.text: It was not until we purchased this item and opened it up that we found out this item can't be used if the recipient has a pacemaker. Would have been helpful had we know prior to the purchase. Have no idea it's value as it was returned.
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: So Good
customer_reviews.text: Really like these headphones. They are so much more advanced than my 10+ year old Sony ones they replace. The digital input is delightful. Means can listen on headphones as well as others hearing the TV speakers. Like the Surround Sound feature. Sheer quality of the sound is amazing. Great for listening to. Xmas musicals. Also reception while moving around house is great if go to kitchen to get a coffee or even hang out the washing. So much better than old tech. Can’t truly compare with alternative modern headphones but I have no regrets with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AkosG

customer_reviews.title: Headset can be used with TV silent or with TV volume turned up.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the headphones. I can turn the TV volume down to zero and listen to the headset without bothering anyone or I can wear the headset (I’m a little hard of hearing), control my volume, while those watching with me can adjust the TV volume to the level they like. The only drawback was no instructions to pair the headset antenna with the TV. I read some of the previous reviews and was able to work it out. I have a Samsung UN55MU6071 semi-smart TV (no Bluetooth). Here is what I needed to do to pair it with the headset antenna. Settings>Sound>Expert Settings>Digital Output Audio Format - PCM
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Something is not working
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one, put everything together and went to install to Cable box, no RCA connector. Ordered another one and same deal. I had another brand unit that was defective so I used the adapter from it. I have had it less than 10 months and now it won't charge or take a charge. I put in new AAA rechargeable batteries and it will not charge up. I don't know if it's the charger or receiver and no place local to take it. It has a two year warranty. It sure has worked good up to now. What must I do?
customer_reviews.author: Wilfred R. Claborn

customer_reviews.title: worked fine for about 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: worked as it should have for about 2 hours but then started cutting out intermittently for several seconds at a time, which came as no surprise as the seller sent me a product that was re-packaged but advertised as new. then said seller gave me an extremely difficult time returning said product by acting as if he sent me a new product and that I was making up a story... probably repackaged by seller (to pass off as new) because they didn't work very well (cutting in and out).
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunate purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got a bad pair of these headphones or they don’t don’t work properly. It cuts in and out constantly, even with the main unit right next to me, but it’s giving me an electric shock when I wear them. It’s too late for me to return them now as I don’t use them that much, but I would recommend not purchasing them. Hopefully it’s just this pair, but otherwise an electric shock and static electricity is what I’m experiencing, with constant pauses/interruptions in whatever I’m listening to. Could be just a bad pair, but right now I don’t recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Belvedere

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Poor, RUDE customer service. It was explained to me just now that the ear pieces...that, in my opinion, ARE a part of the whole unit....are NOT part of the warranty. According to the company....the ear pieces are disposable “just like batteries and cables” I was told!!! And yes, I HAVE replaced the earpieces a couple of times already because the plastic flakes off from use. So, because they CAN be replaced, I was RUDELY told that they are considered dispose, and not covered. (I asked because the TABS broke on them). Was not happy SIMPLY due to the customer service being so rude!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Scanlon

customer_reviews.title: abosutely wonderful
customer_reviews.text: They are unbelievable. I blew a whistle for over 30 years on a railroad; Therefore I am hard of hearing. The volume works great and with the surround sound you feel like you are in the theater. Before I had some sonys that were about a hundred dollars and I liked them a lot but there is no comparison between them and the Sennheiser.Easy to install and a must for hard of hearing. on the Sony I had the volume all the way up and still had some problems. Volume Is not near all the way up and I hear perfectly on the Sennheisers I am saying this because it is the truth as I know it.
customer_reviews.author: clay alexander

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: My husband wears hearing aids and it was hard to understand the TV. When closed captioning disappeared from our TV, I researched headphones to aid his TV viewing pleasure. We did get closed captioning back after getting a new DVR receiver from DirecTV (just in case someone else has this problem). However, the Sennheiser wireless headphones work wonderfully. They have increased my husband's TV viewing pleasure 95%. We still use closed captioning for those few words neither of us can quite catch. Thank you for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: NicrisGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works great, as advertized...I ordered 2...had trouble getting head sets to both work on one transmitter. Thanks to Amazon's help all I had to do was charge each unit on the same transmitter....My wife and I love them...HM
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for hearing impaired.
customer_reviews.text: Samsung tv speakers sad. Plus I'm mid seventies. I would have to have volume way up. And I like a lot of English movies and Netflix. Where both are a problem when trying to discern speaker's narrative. All settled by purchasing these headphones. Headphones seemed tight over first week's use, but either I'm getting use to them or they are loosening up with a lot less discomfort. Can't go wrong, especially for hearing impaired viewers.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient padding
customer_reviews.text: After using for a while, I found my head hurt due to headset upper padding not being thick enough. It deflates to nothing. This left the hard metal contacts resting on the top of my head. The headphones are not light. I rigged up a solution with bubble wrap and packing tape. I'm quite the sight (LOL). They also don't have the range that my Sony wireless pair got... it says something about wifi sensitivity, but isn't every house covered in wifi?
customer_reviews.author: Withoutrestraint

customer_reviews.title: Even Better Than  We Expected
customer_reviews.text: The sound on the RS175 is amazing, clears up movie mumbling. Setup was easy. I will give a separate review of the headphones. I give Sennheiser customer service a 10 star rating. They helped figure out which model would work best with our TV. They answered every question promptly, even when I asked the same question multiple times making sure I understood the answer. They were there to help with setup if needed, but setup was so simple we didn't need help.
customer_reviews.author: KAK

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT = RS 175 Headphones + Optical Splitter + Sonos Playbar + Samsung 4k TV
customer_reviews.text: A lot of good reviews here, but kudos to R.K. Greene's nice reporting with great details. An optical splitter allows my Sonos Playbar to work the same way it always works, with or without the headphones on, and they both keep their own separate volume levels (note the two PCM settings needed with the Samsung TV). It's very cool to have the sound bar on with a low level, and the reach for the headphones and sit down to enjoy movie watching with serious soundtrack power. It has the solid Sennheiser quality you'd expect, with great sound and laudable surround modes.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne near Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Greatly improves quality of listening.
customer_reviews.text: I give these headphones 5 full stars because they really make a difference in the quality of the sound. I’m constantly backing up movies without the headphones, because even though I have the volume up loud, I can’t hear everything they say, especially if the movie has music in the background. With the headphones, that isn’t a problem. I can hear everything perfectly, even with music, and I don’t have to have the tv volume up loud, which my wife appreciates. Comfort-wise I would give these only 4 stars, but the quality of the sound more than makes up for the slight discomfort so I definitely give these a 5.
customer_reviews.author: SPR618

customer_reviews.title: Reduced range ... A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model as a replacement for an earlier model, a TR120. The 175RF does not reach everywhere in the house as the TR120 did, severely limiting its usefulness. That said, the sound quality is excellent but much of it lost on me because of my hearing loss (a main reason I use headphones). The TR120 cost 1⁄3 as much as the 175RF, and I'm still using it rather than the latter. So, I was disappointed but am keeping the 175RF as backup.
customer_reviews.author: Counterpoint

customer_reviews.title: This is a great sound system
customer_reviews.text: Previously, I bought a Sennheiser 170 system several years ago... It still works well but I like this Sennheiser 175 system better. Sennheiser has improved the "pairing" between the transmitter and the headphones... The sound quality is excellent and it's easy to use... This unit is more expensive than others I've shopped but, the quality of the sound and the workmanship justify the expense... I would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: zuggie

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser RS 175 RF Wireless Headphone  replacement work great.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Sennheiser RS 175 RF Wireless Headphone System. Followed instructions to a T. All LED's worked like they should, but no sound transmitted to the headset. Having 50 years of repairing electronics, I verified the system was not working and it was not me. Amazon made it easy to return the RS175 RF. The replacement came and work perfect soon as I connected it. Amazing sound for head phones. This is my second set of Sennheiser headphones. Had the other set three years and always works. I love hearing every small sound is a movie. My wife is happy they are on my old ears.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: ... audiophile but I can tell the difference between a good headphone and a not so good one
customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile but I can tell the difference between a good headphone and a not so good one. I got this to watch movies (and I like action movies:) at night when kids are in bed. I was not very happy at the idea of giving up my 5.1 audio system for this headphone. While it doesn't give you the same experience as you would have from a 5.1 system, it does a great job of delivering crisp sound and the surround sound option does make a big difference. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Zeeshan Rasheed

customer_reviews.title: Great Comfortable Head Phones
customer_reviews.text: These are a replacement for my older Sennheiser phones. They are great. Excellent sound, useful and functional features, long operational time between charges, and comfortable wear ability. Not too tight and not to loose.
customer_reviews.author: DrEwok

customer_reviews.title: Leaving the room results in loss of signal.
customer_reviews.text: With the Sennheiser wireless headphones I used to have, I was able to listen to the TV while working outside or in my office. Unfortunately, I dropped the headphones and broke them. They're no longer available so I bought these. These work very well for listening to the TV with separate volume controls from the built-in speakers on the TV. That allows me to hear better with higher volume without subjecting others in the house to the it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Stine

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to hook up with older tV or stereo
customer_reviews.text: Would not work with my current TV and Stereo. So had to buy a dual connector wire which would not work either. Then I called customer support who was unable to help me figure out a way to make it work. Around $ 8 bucks I then asked what would i need to run it through the Stereo headphone jack. Customer support told me what to buy so I spent $ 10 Sounds great and works easily but hated I had to spend another $ 18 after spending close to $ 200 when purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Great sound with a couple of problems.
customer_reviews.text: The sound and noise insulation is outstanding. However, it fits very tightly on the head, makes your ears hot pretty quickly, and the function buttons are weird. For example you have to hold down the power button for two and a half seconds just to turn on or off (why on Earth didn't they just have a switch?). The volume up and down are buttons, when it should just be a dial. And the base and surround are a little confusing. If you have a large head, do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I had heard the Sennheiser products were very good but the RS 175 RF system blew me away! Without a doubt, the best over-the-ear headphones I have ever owner. The product description states 'surround sound' but they fail to mention it is 2.1. Even so, the quality, responsiveness, comfort and feel are excellent. Would not hesitate to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable, nice fitting headphones that work
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product--one of the few where you can listen to the tv with earphones on and someone else can have the volume on. Most don't do that--you just get the earphones volume and noone else cana hear it as it mutes the volume . They are comfortable, easy to use and sound is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Hulacious

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are a godsend. My SO has “ultrasonic” hearing, so everything is always too loud for him, when I can barely hear it. These allow us to watch movies & tv without fighting over the volume. They sound great and have a really good range (I can go into the kitchen while wearing them without them cutting out). They’re very comfortable to wear for an extended period of time too (perfect for binge watching).
customer_reviews.author: aim

customer_reviews.title: Does not reach everywhere in/out of my home.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is as advertised, however, when I am walking around my house the headphone do not follow me. It appears that the company wants you to remain still in the room where your audio system is located. I still have my old wireless radio signal headphone to do my yard work. So with that being said, I enjoyed the sound quality, noise cancellation, and volume control, however, I give it a four (4) for listening while on the go around the house (in & Out).
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, but can't use two at the same time
customer_reviews.text: Have used and loved Sennheiser headphones over forty years, and the overall quality of these doesn't disappoint. Setup was easy. The headphones are comfortable on your head and the sound is great for headphones in this price level. The controls are easy and intuitive. My only complaint is I purchased another pair so two of us could watch the same movie late a night without waking the rest of the family. However, the second pair simply will not stay synced with the source material. No problem with the first set paired. Support, video tutorials, troubleshooting articles could not solve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: SeeJay

customer_reviews.title: Big and bulky, limited range
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is OK, though you could certainly get much better sound with a cheaper set of wired headphones. The bass is very pronounced, without turning on the bass boost feature. What I don't like about these headphones is that they are heavy, bulky, and not very comfortable, and the wireless range is limited. The range would be fine for watching TV, but I was hoping they would work well for walking around the house listening to music. I have a fairly small house all on one level, and when I get too far from the base, the sound starts to break up.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I'm a disabled vet with a hearing disability. I wanted somethiun g to help me hear the TV without disturbing my wife..I have a BS in Communications but spent hours trying to get this thing to work...On the positive side the company was very good about giving me a total refund including postage.
customer_reviews.author: Gardnermo

customer_reviews.title: Hookup was super simple and they have lots of volume for people with hearing loss.
customer_reviews.text: OMG...I love these headphones! The sound is awesome and installation took minutes. My hearing is getting bad and I missed most of what was being said on the shows I was watching. Now I don't miss one word!! They are lightweight and comfortable and have lots of volume. I'm so happy I got them but wish I had done it months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with lithium ion batteries
customer_reviews.text: Ad incorrect, does not come with rechargeable lithium ion batteries, headset includes rechargeable nickel metal hydride batteries. Unlike Lithium Ion, Nickel Metal Hydride batteries will not hold a charge for a long period of time off the charger. And a Ni-MH charger will not work with Li-ion batteries so do not plan on replacing Ni-MH batteries with Li-ion batteries. Both digital and analog input works well, comfortable, ear pads easily remove, with a quarter turn, to change Ni-MH rechargeable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: skelley

customer_reviews.title: THESE HEADPHONES ARE AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: THESE HEADPHONES ARE AWESOME!!! Bought these for my wife so so won't have such high volume on the TV(she is getting a bit hard of hearing.) They are really nice. Great sound, comfortable to wear for extended time and set-up was really simple. The wife absolutely is in love with them. I have a set of Sennheiser earbuds I use for my MP3 player and cellphone and they are terrific which is why I decided to purchase these. You will not go wrong if you do the same. Thanks Amazon for super-fast shipping - you saved my sanity!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really amazing sound - you get drawn into the action with ...
customer_reviews.text: Really amazing sound - you get drawn into the action with these on. The only minus for me are the contacts at the top of the headset where they meet the top of the head. My skull is a bit pointy at the top and after a couple of hours they hurt a little. We got these to replace a pair of Sony wireless which fell apart after 1.5 yrs, These are much sturdier and they recharge by induction - only pop on the headrest and forget about any cables. I got the package with a pair and they are pricey but well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Nigella

customer_reviews.title: Great for private listening and/or for the hearing impaired.
customer_reviews.text: Great for private listening and/or for the hearing impaired. My old one fell apart after many years of use. This new one is far superior with a clarity of sound that I have not experienced before. It is a little tricky to get it on the charger and to make volume adjustments while wearing it but with time I am getting use to it. If you wear glasses while watching TV the padding on this headset makes a very annoying sound rubbing against the glasses frame. All in all it is a keeper and a much needed one.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Hiker

customer_reviews.title: if it don't fit the sound does not matter
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these. the first lasted 3 years, but I really liked them. So when I tried these new pair I could only ware then for a few hours before I go a horrible headake. I tried twice to make sure it was the earphones, and yep it was. I sent them back. they are high quality, good sound easy to install. lots of connection options. But like the headline says... if it don't fit!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Owltown

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless headphones, if discounted.
customer_reviews.text: Already being very impressed by 8+ years of using an earlier model of Sennheiser's wireless headphones ( 3 pairs - RS-130) I purchased 2 sets of the RS-175 Headphones. The headset, charging unit, connectivity options (optical and/or analog) and sound quality have been improved. The comfort level personally is not as good, but now that they are a closed design headphone (RS-130 were an open design )those people near you will not hear much, if anything at all! If you can find these for less than $185, go for it. *The Retail is a bit much @ $275.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Marital Bliss
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases we ever made. My husband and I like to watch hockey, but the crowd noise was painful to hear. My husband doesn’t share my love of silence. We also have four kids, and one likes to watch YouTube videos of video gamers. These headphones have saved my sanity. I don’t have to have the physical discomfort of hearing the sound and my family can watch at a volume they prefer.
customer_reviews.author: belljennifer71

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: Not able to play movies using my soundbar due to ill family member. This product delivers the sound quality, bass notes, and surround sound I wanted to fully experience movies. The only problem is that I have a big head and the phones are a bit tight. It gets annoying after a few hours, but the quality of the product outweighs that small issue.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Wehler

customer_reviews.title: I recommend these for watching TV
customer_reviews.text: These headphones work great! I use them to watch TV. Bass response is fantastic. Voices are clear and easy to understand. Background noises and off screen sounds like doors closing and cars passing are crisp and clear. I watch Netflix a lot through a Roku player hooked up to a Yamaha receiver. I like these headphones better than my Klipsch 5.1 speaker system. The surround sound simulation works surprisingly well. Comfort: I wear them hours on end without sore ears or headache from excess tension. I've had no problem with reception from the base unit. battery life is all day plus some.
customer_reviews.author: Cris Deraud

customer_reviews.title: Get your sanity back
customer_reviews.text: I don’t personally use these but bought them as a gift for my husband. Let’s just say the peace has been restored in our house when he is watching tv upstairs! 🤣 I used to hear the TV in my kitchen from the upstairs game room because he listened to it so loud. These headphones are the best investment I’ve made!
customer_reviews.author: MT_12

customer_reviews.title: (Disclosure - not an audio expert) Everything sounds good but the biggest difference between this and my cheap ...
customer_reviews.text: A+ comfort A+ sound. (Disclosure - not an audio expert) Everything sounds good but the biggest difference between this and my cheap wired headphones is the bass. I didn't fully appreciate how obnoxious the bass is on pop songs until I got these. Negatives: The sound will drop out for a fraction of a second occasionally. I expect this is because I live in an apartment building with tons of wireless signals everywhere. The charging system is kind of awkward. You want the base to be hidden out of the way somewhere but you need it someplace handy for easy charging. But I can't think of much of a better way they could have done it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nerd

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Sennheiser headphones for my TV for years and they finally gave out recently. I already knew that when they gave out I would purchase another Sennheiser set. I am again NOT disappointed! These are even better than the ones that I had. They are a little pricy however you get what you pay for! I would recommend this set to anyone that is looking for something like this. GREAT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: These headphones were relatively easy to hook up
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were relatively easy to hook up. I had an older Sony pair that were beginning to skip quite a bit. These are radio frequency not blue tooth and it seems to make a difference. The quality of the sound is excellent. I can understand every word. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easy to use.  Note that they enclose your ears completely.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Sennheiser RF 150 headphones for years. They were "on the ear" while these are "over the ear", completely enclosing my ears. An advantage is that they don't fall off when I bend over. A disadvantage is that if I need to talk to someone I have to take them off, not just mute them. There's a simulated "surround sound" effect, with two levels, that I don't find useful. I'm hard of hearing and wear hearing aids when I'm out of the house. These allow me to hear the TV clearly, increasing the volume as necessary without annoying my wife, whose hearing is still acute.
customer_reviews.author: DukeBedford

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with both the sound quality and the wearing comfort of these headphones. My only slight complaint is that it can be a little tricky to operate the buttons on the earpiece, due to the way they are placed. I'm sure I'll get used to that in short order, so it's a very minor thing. The main point is they they sound great and are comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Willow Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to Wear
customer_reviews.text: Although the sound quality on these is very good I find the fit very uncomfortable. There is insufficient padding on top and they also fit too tightly against my head. I wear glasses and that makes them even more uncomfortable. I can't wear them for more than about 15 minutes at a time. I regret purchasing these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are the best piece of home headphones out there.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, great connectivity, quality of the plastic and overall build is superb. Once again Sennheiser proves its known world wide reputation on the market for being one of the best. Can't go wrong with these cost vs. value, very well recommended headphones. One thing can be improved is the cover materials on the ear cushions, could be full leather instead of synhetic semi-lether as today. I bought these for my father, he absolutely loves them. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Alexandr Slaboussov

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Simply Awful.
customer_reviews.text: Was really looking forward to upgrading from the Sennheiser I have had for 5+ years. This device was awful and such a let down. The audio is twice the volume out of the left as the right and no way to balance it out. Neither the bass boost or surround worked to give me a good audio experience. I made it one hour into a movie and resorted to plugging my old headset in. It simply isn't usable. I would recommend you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan S.

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser makes great headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned four sets of Sennheiser head phones over the course of several years and these are the best. I am hearing impaired and these headphones allow me to hear sound while watching TV and listening to music while other members of the family can set their sound level that works for them. The headphones are well made and has features that make their use easy. They can be turned on/off from the earpiece and optical input which is required with Samsung TV and Sonos sound speaker system.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Needs battery level display
customer_reviews.text: First off, I gave this product 4 stars only because they lack a battery level indicator. Something simple like red, yellow, or green LEDs would work. The sound quality is terrific. With stereo , you can hear activity off screen, right or left come into view. My hearing isn't the best (I usually need subtitles) but with these headphones, I don't and I can understand accents better. Late at night I don't worry about bothering my wife. Easy to install-use the fiber optic cable connection on your TV. No delay in the sound. They are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this product. I own Bose Bluetooth headset but wanted RF headset because I do not always sit directly in front of tv. This product has excellent sound quality and is extremely easy to setup and use. In my opinion it exceeds the performance of my Bose headset even though it does not have noise cancellation. On the other hand, you will not disturb others that may be in close proximity while in use due to close back feature. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of headphones I've ever owned and I now see they are on sale for 199 while I write this and that is a steal. I searched the internet all over and did tons of research before I decided on these headphones and I've worn them everyday for almost 2 years now. I wanted wireless obviously but more importantly to me was changeable batteries, which they offer. Bought a set of triple A rechargeable batteries and a battery charger and I never have to worry about having dead headphones. (Important to note, I rarely ever have to change the batteries and if I do it's most likely from my own neglect to properly dock them after use. )
customer_reviews.author: Greg hult

customer_reviews.title: Picky about Toslink setup and short range
customer_reviews.text: It is finiky about the connection, it would work with my Sony TV but wouldn't work in the back of the Genie Mini box. Also the sound quality is good but the range sucks. I was replacing an old set of Sennheisers that only has RCA connectors. After trying a RCA to Toslink adapater to no avail I had to throw down big on these. Super funny I can go all the way the the bottom floor of my house into the my laundry room (very far away in a 3000+ square foot house) and these start to cut out just outside my bedroom. Why would those older $59 specials have such range and these do not.
customer_reviews.author: Maresha Sceats Leeds

customer_reviews.title: This is Great
customer_reviews.text: I have some hearing loss as well as tinnitus. It is great to be able to hear the words and hear the small things that I have been missing in the TV and Movies. Also, it is awesome to be able to block out all other noise except the TV. These are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear & great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: My wife is very happy that I can watch & listen to TV Sporting events while she is in the same room working on her bookkeeping projects with no noise to distract her concentration! That is the main purpose that I made the purchase. However, I find that the sound quality is an additional benefit. Also, I can walk throughout the house and still hear the program. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: prices

customer_reviews.title: My husband love his wireless headphone system
customer_reviews.text: My husband love his wireless headphone system. I gave him this for Christmas, he had picked out the brand as he had heard great things about Sennheiser. I like to keep the TV low when watching movies or shows, whereas he likes to watch with the TV blaring. This was perfect for us and I can still control the TV volume separate from these headphones. He can now hear sounds off in the background of the film which he loves as he can pick up on more of the audio than listening via TV speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

product_meta.title: Sennheiser RS 175 RF Wireless Headphone System
product_meta.description: The Sennheiser RS 175 is a perfect complement to your home entertainment system. This digital wireless headphone delivers exceptional sound quality and freedom from wires. The ergonomic around ear, closed back design reduces background noise while providing an exceptionally comfortable fit. You’ll be immersed in the sound of your favorite music, TV or movies without disturbing anyone else in the room! Do not expose to moisture.
feature_bullets: Compact, ergonomic over-ear headphones. Connectivity Technology: Wireless
Digital wireless technology ensures that signal transmission remains clear & accurate
Bass boost & surround sound listening modes. Maximum sound pressure level : 114 dB at 1kHz, 3 percentage THD. THD, total harmonic distortion : <0.5 percentage at 1 kHz, 100 dB SPL

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,548 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
